tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Company description


FORTYEIGHT.ai offers next-gen transparency for artificial intelligence and facial recognition technology.


We help people benefit from the full potential of cutting edge technology, while retaining control over the effect it has on their lives.


We'll also shortly announce a transparency layer for COVID-19 surveillance, helping to ensure citizens can benefit from the protections it creates, without sacrificing their rights.


Job description


We're looking for a motivated, organised and dependable Sales Executive to help us bring the product to market* through lead generation, appointment setting and demand generation.


Successful candidates may have a few years of sales experience and be looking for a temporary position while on furlough, or someone with less experience who's looking to prove themselves.


This is an exciting opportunity to join a startup in its early days, working closely with the founding team to build momentum as the consumer app and enterprise API nears its launch date.


You'll be working fully remote, and receive base salary plus bonus & commission structure for each qualified appointment that is set.


What you'll be doing:



  • Industry research to identify leads and opportunities across multiple sectors

  • List building with potential leads and opportunities

  • Generating leads through LinkedIn, Email, Phone

  • Pitching the business / proposition clearly and consistently in written and verbal form

  • Developing leads from outreach to appointment bookings with pre-sales team


Requirements:



  • Understanding of the sales process and dynamics

  • Outbound calling experience, and ability to vocally navigate through gatekeepers

  • Excellent Communication skills both written and oral and good clear telephone manner

  • Good attention to detail and organisation

  • Experience using a CRM, preferably Hubspot or similar

  • Computer Literate and experienced in database navigation preferred

  • Ability to write detailed follow up notes for business reporting

  • Motivation to always finish your end of day follow-ups / close outs

  • Superb interpersonal skills, including the ability to quickly build rapport with both customers and suppliers.

items.title: Work from Home Entry Level Sales Representatives $17.00 Base Pay Per Appt.
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Work from Home Entry Level Sales Representatives
Vector Marketing is currently holding virtual interviews for entry level sales rep positions. Our representatives have an opportunity to work from home selling Cutco products through one on one appointments that emphasizes customer service. Experience is not necessary because our online training is designed to help people do well immediately - as long as someone is willing to learn, they can be successful.
We provide flexible schedules for anyone looking to make some extra income during this unpredictable time. This entry level sales position is a great opportunity for college students and 2020 high school graduates looking for summer work.
What we offer:
Excellent pay competitive starting base pay, commissions available based on performance
Solid training we teach our reps how to do well in this role before they start, and offer continued support and additional training as time goes on. (Many of our top representatives had never had a real job before working with us.)
Flexible scheduling we help our reps create a schedule that works for them. Some work as much as possible while others choose to be super part time around other commitments such as online classes or other jobs.
Choice of location most interviews and trainings take place online through virtual interviews and training, reps can conveniently work from home.
What we require:
Enjoy working with people
At least 18 years old or 17 and a 2020 HS Graduate
Conditions apply
Able to start at least on a part time basis within the next 7 10 days
Willing to learn and apply new skills.
Who would do well:
People who have done well with us in the past have had experience in retail, fast food, cashier, call center or telemarketing (which by the way, we don t do), administrative assistant, receptionist/office work, landscaping, and in just about any field you can imagine. We welcome all applicants who have a positive attitude and are willing to work hard and learn new things.
This entry level sales position is a great fit for people who are looking for part time or a full time remote work. If you are a student looking for summer work or just someone who is looking for a flexible schedule, our opportunities can work around your needs. Because of the quality of our training, we re able to take on people who are still in school or who entered the job market right out of high school and train them to quickly become successful.
If you think you would be a great fit for our sales team fill out the contact information and a receptionist will follow up with you about setting up a virtual interview with a manager.

items.content:
Director of Growth & Customer Acquisition

Description:

Are you an E-commerce guru that loves everything about marketing and customer acquisition? Do you nerd out on A/B testing and attribution? Are you an expert Facebook marketer that knows Power Editor inside out? Do you follow all the latest trends with FB ads and are the first to test new ad formats and features? Are you also well versed in Google Ad Words, Display, YouTube ads, etc.? Love landing page optimization, conversion rate optimization and funnel building? Then we want to talk to you.

ESSIO is a fast-growing, subscription-first D2C company in the home fragrance space, with a focus on direct response marketing. We're currently looking for a Director of Growth to oversee all of our customer acquisition efforts.

As Director of Growth, you will primarily manage the following awesome initiatives:
  • Paid customer acquisition across multiple media channels (Facebook Ads, Google, YouTube, Pinterest, Taboola/Outbrain) with a focus on optimizing ROAS for our trial offer
  • Managing creative development and copywriting for ads across all above channels, with a focus on reducing cost of traffic/acquisition
  • Conversion rate and landing page optimization efforts to optimize both AOV and conversion rate
  • Monitor attribution and analytics, with a focus on CPA, AOV, ROAS and LTV
Requirements:

We'd love it if you have the following skills and qualifications:
  • Deep knowledge of the ins and outs of the Shopify platform and corresponding apps
  • Unrivaled knowledge of Facebook Ads platform and media buying experience across all major ad networks
  • Versatile understanding of all forms of digital marketing, including:
    • Content marketing, email marketing, affiliate marketing, social media marketing, public relations, friend referral marketing, conversion optimization, landing page optimization, paid marketing, retargeting, etc.
  • Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel, comfortable running pivot tables, etc.
  • Strong bias for action and getting things done
  • Relevant experience working with subscription customer acquisition
  • Startup experience a significant plus
Benefits:
  • Ability to work remotely as well as be an early employee in a fast-growing startup. Your work and decision-making will have a huge impact on the company's bottom line.
  • Monthly health expense allowance.
  • Salary commensurate with experience.

Remote

But to do so, we need a world-class junior sales person on our team that can help to identify our perfect clients and help determine if one of Dan Martell’s programs are the vessel to get them there.

Are you that person? Do you love technology? Want to make a BIG impact on the SaaS founders we serve?

If chatting with entrepreneurs and working on a world-class team is something that gets you going every day, then we want to speak with you!

  • Do you love dig–deep and understand customers “real” problems?
  • Do you have exceptional written and verbal communication skills?
  • Do you like innovation and technology and want to meet some of the most inspiring entrepreneurs on the planet?
  • Do you long for a job with freedom and the option to work from home?

Dan Martell is an award-winning entrepreneur and investor. He founded multiple companies including Clarity and Flowtown. He was also named Canada’s top angel investor having completed over 40+ investments with amazing companies like Udemy, Intercom, and Unbounce.

Our B2B SaaS Coaching programs were created to help other software businesses grow and succeed. Our team works together to help others make their dreams a reality!

Now, we need a high performing SDR to help us scale to new heights and continue to provide incredible support to our world-class clients.

This Jr. Sales/SDR role will amplify your career. From taking on new challenges to following the lead of incredible mentors, we promise you will grow, learn, and make a difference.

If you’re a person who is inquisitive by nature and loves interacting, educating, and answering questions with SaaS founders from around the world, then this is a role for you!

Your awesomeness includes:

  • Ability to speak with potential customers to understand their pain points and priorities
  • Bring value to everyone you speak with
  • Differentiating from the pack
  • Excellent communication, organizational, and analytical skills
  • Developing educational material, including presentations, sales scripts and case studies to be included in the company operations manual
  • Passion for software and technology
  • Experienced with online tools (ie: Google docs, sheets, Trello, Zoom, Calendly, Pipedrive)
  • Extremely comfortable engaging with driven entrepreneurs – Delivering value and ensuring prospects are a great fit.
  • Experience working with a team across multiple disciplines
  • Experience in sales or customer service/communication roles are preferred

What you’ll do

As a Junior. Sales Rep, you’ll be responsible for:

  • Qualifying leads
  • Reaching out to warm prospects
  • Sell by chat
  • Manage sales pipeline and proactively move prospects forward
  • Documenting systems for the next generation of danmartell.com junior sales people
  • Providing timely feedback to marketing department around continually improving the quality of leads
  • Completing prospecting of clients to hand off to scale specialists.
  • Contributing to quarterly company revenue goals
  • Meet sales qualified leads / objectives
  • Field calls for the Growth Accelerator program.

items.content:
Remote

Role Description

  • Job Title :Sales Account Executive
  • Classification :Full-Time
  • Exempt Salaried
  • US Based Candidates Only
  • Reports to :CEO

Summary/Objective

Instant Teams is seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic remote Sales Account Executive (AE) – who will become the first in this role to join our growing Company. The AE will be responsible for attacking SMB to Enterprise sized direct accounts, and teaming collaboratively with our Sales Organization, and a new Channel Development Manager and programs.

This position will utilize an integrated strategy that may include, but not limited to, marketing automation, inbound lead response / outbound outreach techniques, working with various lead lists, social networking, industry networking, military connected community liaison marketing. This early stage leader will play a crucial role in creating, implementing and continually improving Sales best practices and procedures to build the core growth engine for the Company.

Essential Functions

  • Utilize Direct and Channel Sales best practices in building Go To Market attack plans
  • This role is predominantly outbound and you will be responsible for building a pipeline via prospecting and managing deal cycles from generation through to close
  • Coordinates the involvement of company personnel, including sales, operations, and management resources, in order to meet assigned quotas
  • Achieves assigned targets for profitable sales volume, and Company strategic objectives
  • Sells-through partner organizations to end users in coordination with partner sales resources. (There may be a number of Military – Connected partners.)
  • Drives adoption of company programs and campaigns with assigned partners
  • Providing consistent, concise, accurate, and timely weekly/monthly sales reports to management
  • Must have strong inner drive, and self-discipline
  • We are very metrics driven and hold ourselves to a high level of accountability

Preferred Education and Experience

  • Four (4) year degree and/or minimum of 5-7 years of Direct Sales Experience for a cloud based app (preferably subscription based).
  • Experience with Hubspot (CRM platform), and LinkedIn is highly preferred
  • Should have proficiency in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
  • Must be experienced with Direct and Channel sell-through partner techniques, be a successful prospector
  • Show a proven track record achieving assigned quotas
  • Ability to multi-task daily projects and commitments and employ structured selling methods is required
  • Experience in staffing models
  • Experience in HR Tech
  • Familiarity with military demographics
  • Familiarity with our software tools: HubSpot, Zoom, Google Suite, Trello, Slack

Competencies

  • Self-confidence, fast learner who can adapt to dynamic remote environment
  • Independent, hard-working, can-do attitude
  • Data-driven mindset
  • Cross-departmental skills
  • Communication proficiency, excellent verbal and written communication
  • Time management
  • Collaborative
  • Flexible
  • Tech-savvy
  • Fast-paced
  • Self-starter
  • Open to flex hours

Supervisory Responsibilities

Sales Team of 3-5

Role Details

Physical Demands and Work Environment

This position is completely remote and requires the use of a computer. Please make an effort to work in a safe, quiet, ergonomic space to minimize any health hazards.

EEO and Harassment Statement

Instant Teams provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants, contractors, and employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of work, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Instant Teams expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment. Improper interference with the ability of Instant Teams’ contractors, employees, partners, customers, or any other people working with us in a professional capacity, to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

Other Duties

Overtime may occasionally be required during high-volume periods. You will be notified ahead of time when there is an anticipation of overtime and made aware of which dates have been authorized. Overtime is only to be used with prior approval from a supervisor.

Disclaimer: This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities, and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Apply for job

items.title: Shopify: Key Account Manager - Shopify Fulfillment Network
items.content:
Key Account Manager - Shopify Fulfillment Network

About the role

Shopify has redefined commerce, raising the standard for how companies of all sizes sell their products and services online and off. With 1,000,000+ merchants in more than 175 different countries, and the most innovative platform on the market, we continue to grow rapidly while constantly looking for new ways to impact and disrupt markets.

Yes, you read that right - in this time of Covid-19, Shopify is still hiring. We're definitely open for business, and we're fighting hard to keep hundreds of thousands of other businesses open as well. If that sounds like something you could get behind, keep reading.

We're looking for a Key Account Manager (we call them Fulfillment Merchant Managers) who will focus on fulfillment, logistics, and e-commerce operations.  If you’ve led fulfillment & operations for a consumer goods brand, are well-versed in shipping and inventory management, and can use your interpersonal skills to develop strong relationships with merchants utilizing the Shopify Fulfillment Network (SFN), then we want to hear from you. 

This is a remote role, but you must be within the United States or Canada.


This is the sort of thing you'll be responsible for:
  • Understanding the merchant, their vision and business as well as their goals and expectations for SFN. You'll manage their SFN account and amplify their experience
  • Helping to build strong relationships with merchants and their teams
  • Coaching merchants to grow their business by partnering with them on goal development, and providing tailored and structured recommendations to achieve those goals.
  • Identifying areas for improvement, including opportunities for product adoption and implementing new SFN features; recommending ways to best utilize SFN’s solutions
  • Helping merchants onboard seamlessly to SFN
  • Partnering with internal Shopify teams to advocate for merchants’ needs and requests. Think working on technical issues with Shopify's escalated Support teams as an example of this.
  • Demonstrating an in-depth understanding of industry trends and how they could apply to the merchants you work with

You'll need to have:
  • Experience in a senior operations-type role within a consumer goods or e-commerce brand. You have ideally been on the 'merchant side.'
  • Experience in various fulfillment functions (i.e. allocation, order fulfillment, returns processing, inventory management, etc.) You’re no stranger to packing slips, label printing, bin locations, or pallets.
  • Experience working with multiple stakeholders. Relationship management is your secret weapon when advocating for the merchant.
  • Understanding of e-commerce best practices. You'll be the merchant's main point of contact for all big-picture support.
  • Knowledge of the e-commerce ecosystem. There are many moving parts and you need to see how they fit together in the best possible way.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and a relentless attention to detail.
  • Data driven approach to managing operations performance.
  • A passion for commerce. Maybe you’ve even built a store for a friend, or run your own business?

It would be truly awesome if you also had:
  • A deep understanding of the Shopify platform.
  • Experience running your own business. You know what it means to be an entrepreneur and can share your learnings with our merchants.
  • Exposure to fulfillment industry trends and requirements (Barcoding, custom packaging, Peak planning, etc)

If you feel excited after reading this, then address your cover letter to Greg and click "Apply Now". We're looking forward to hearing from you!

This posting will close May 8 at noon EST.

At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. items.title: Sales manager for a disruptive tech startup
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Smart Migrator is an exciting and very disruptive tech startup (SaaS) based in London. We are revolutionising cloud migrations globally by building the world's first fully automated cloud migration platform. Everyone recognises that cloud computing is the future of IT. It can reduce costs, offer business agility and scalability and can be a platform for utilising countless opportunities, embracing the best of IT innovation.


The journey to the cloud, however, is very complex and expensive. Most SMEs and even some large enterprises cannot afford the high cost to migrate. We are set to disrupt the global $120B market (expected to reach $448B by 2025) by offering the first of its kind solution that empowers companies of all size to make the critical transformational step. Our fully automated platform allows companies to migrate to the cloud 3-10x cheaper and 6-10x faster than traditional managed migrations services (from the likes of Accenture, IBM, DXC Technology and more). 


We have built a very substantial MVP that automatically migrates Linux servers to AWS and we are currently fundraising so we can expand it to a full platform that has substantial capabilities and includes the other big clouds. In the current lockdown, fundraising has been put on hold but we are still actively looking to find companies that we can help migrate.


In this sense, we are looking for sales professionals who are currently furloughed and are curious to help spread the message for a unique innovative technology. This is mainly working on finding and presenting to new customers, following leads from social media campaigns and everything else involved in B2B software sales. Ideally, we are looking for candidates with experience in B2B software sales or other tech sales.


For now, we are only looking for furloughed volunteers. However, once we get funded, there would be permanent job opportunities for the right talent. We are a small, friendly and very passionate team spread across London, Sofia (Bulgaria) and Buenos Aires (Argentina). 


If what we are doing excites you and you are looking to add your mark and keep busy during the lockdown, we would love to hear from you. Keep safe :-)

items.content:

The product has been built with recruitment agencies in mind, saving time, money and improving the efficiency in day-to-day recruiting operations by bringing it under one roof. 


Job description


We're looking for an experienced sales professional to join their fast-paced team of misfits. You will be heading up the sales on their software product aimed at the recruitment industry. The role is completely remote, with 5 others in the team working around the world. Your main market will be recruitment agencies, 40,000 of which are registered in the UK, breaking in and forging relationships. 


You will be joining the company right at the start of an exciting journey. Your direct manager will be the executive team, CEO & COO. This will give you the opportunity to really make your mark, with huge opportunity to develop as the business grows.  


£30,000 to £35,000 Basic + 10% commission on all sales


The main product you will be selling will be subscription-based and you will receive a 10% recurring commission every month for your subscription sales as well as 10% commission on the one-off products.

items.title: Institutional Sales Specialist -Cardio - South Philadelphia - Remote
items.content:
Job Description

*This is a remote role*

Over 6 Million people in the US are affected by Heart Failure in the US with that number expected to increase to 8 million by 2030. Novartis has been at the forefront of Cardiovascular treatment for decades, delivering groundbreaking medicines that extend and improve life, and that’s where we intend to stay there.

We are Novartis. Join us and help reimagine medicine.

Your key responsibilities:

The Institutional Sales Specialist (ISS) will be responsible for driving appropriate access pull through in targeted hospital with the CRM brand portfolio. Responsibilities will include driving demand by developing, coordinating, and implementing a strategic business plan for identified top strategic hospitals within assigned CRM academic and government institutions. The ISS will collaborate with CRM Sales, Marketing, US Market Access, Patient Services, and other home office personnel, as appropriate, to execute institution-centric programs aligned with Business Unit strategic imperatives, Legal and Compliance policies.

• This position will report to the CRM Specialty Area Business Leader and will have no direct reports.
• Budget management Sales responsibilities are a component of this position
Position will maintain contact with approximately 10 -15 targeted institutions and will be an integral part in driving the success of the local market.
• Significant travel up to 75% or more required is required.


What you’ll bring to the role:

• Drive Product Access
• Drive Pull Through and Demand Generation
• Institutional Account Business Planning
• Innovation/ Initiative
• Coordination and Collaboration of Cross-functional Stakeholders:
• Local Market Opportunities


EEO Statement The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Minimum requirements

• Undergraduate degree required; MBA preferred
• Strong business background
• 5-7 years of biologics/specialty pharmaceutical sales experience with 2 years in hospital sales in the past 5 years
• Must have a high degree of understanding of the CRM community in general and a working knowledge of Cardiovascular products is preferred
• Must have a strong record of accomplishment of therapeutic area/product knowledge expertise.

items.title: Security Sales Engineer – Secureworks Sales – Remote Atlanta, Georgia
items.content:
Security Sales Engineer – Secureworks Sales – Remote, Georgia

Cybersecurity Services

Secureworks® (NASDAQ: SCWX) is a technology-driven cybersecurity leader that protects organizations in the digitally connected world. Built on proprietary technologies and world-class threat intelligence, our applications and solutions help prevent, detect, and respond to cyber threats. Red Cloak™ software brings advanced threat analytics to thousands of customers, and the Secureworks Counter Threat Platform™ processes over 300B threat events per day. We understand complex security environments and are passionate about simplifying security with Defense in Concert™ so that security becomes a business enabler. More than 4,000 customers across over 50 countries are protected by Secureworks, benefit from our network effect and are Collectively Smarter. Exponentially Safer.™ www.secureworks.com

We enjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages, and reward and recognize our employees for exceptional results. A constant focus on continued learning and growth keeps our team members engaged and excited about “what’s next.” We offer flexible work options when available, and emphasize the importance of work-life balance. We know that when our people are rewarded, recognized, and rejuvenated, we win as a team.

Role Overview

Security Sales Engineers will support a sales team in new client acquisition and revenue growth. Security Sales Engineer will report to the Senior Manager of Sales Engineering. Senior Security Engineers will deliver product presentations, discussion and demonstrations internally and externally on all relevant Secureworks solutions. They will coordinate with Product Marketing, Product Management and Sales Leadership to ensure that Secureworks solutions are timely, appropriate and supported by strong sales tools.

Role Responsibilities

Engage in advanced security architecture discussion with C-level suitePresent Secureworks services from a technical and business perspectivePerform POC of Secureworks technologyAnalyze client needs and design solutions Act as primary point of escalation of technical issues for the Sales teamTravel 50% of the time may be required depending on territory geo

Minimum Requirements

Minimum of 5 years experience in Sales EngineeringMinimum of 4 years experience selling security architecture design, MSSP, security risk assessments, and adversarial threat testing services

Preferences

2 or more certifications: CISSP, CISM, GIAC, QSA, CEH, AWSIndustry knowledge of IOT, ICS, OT and SCADA environmentsBachelor’s Degree or higher

items.content:
About Us


Property Master are the new Digital Mortgage Sourcing Tool for UK Landlords and we’re shaking things up in the mortgage world. Property Master is a young, dynamic fintech start up with a number of exciting partnerships in the pipeline that will provide the next step change in our market share. It provides services to landlords including acting as an online mortgage broker. While our focus is on buy-to-let mortgages we also handle residential mortgages and related insurances ’offline’.


Our online system lets the landlord key in their initial fact find, match them to a set of personalised search results which are pre-screened against all UK products and their lending criteria. No other user-friendly online system does this. Over 10,000 landlords have used Property Master to find a mortgage since its launch almost three years ago and the company holds a five-star status from Trust Pilot. 


Its business as usual for the Property Master team and with an online platform we have successfully transitioned the team to work virtually.


Job Description


We are looking for talented individuals who are furloughed to come join the Property Master team for short pieces of project activity. We are particularly on the hunt for business development managers looking for a challenge in the online mortgage space during the lockdown to help us develop sales and quickly identify and broaden our current range of partnerships and develop further relationships across the market.


Job requirements



  • Ambitious, independent, motivated self starter

  • Background in business development and/or sales environment

  • Confident working virtually developing relationships and maturing potential leads through to established partnerships

  • Team player

  • Willing to get stuck in and go the extra mile


Desired skills and experience


We have a mix of projects so not everyone will have all skill sets but overall, the skills we need are:



  • Previous work in the finance, real estate and mortgage sectors an advantage

  • BDM background and used to identifying and facilitating new partnerships

  • Sales and lead conversion experience

  • We are looking for vibrant individuals who are great at quickly building rapport with customers over the phone chasing targets.


This is an excellent and exciting opportunity to work with a rapidly evolving section of the mortgage market - come and be part of the online mortgage revolution!


Job Type: Furlough- There will be full time opportunities to join our business as we grow.

Join us to sell well, sell with care, sell with empathy and sell for success. 


You'll be supported by a passionate, attentive and experienced team.


We simply ask you to come in with heaps of good energy and an unstoppable "anything is possible" outlook. 


Cool? 


Here's the deal.


Your compensation will be strictly based on your revenue generation success. And we'll make your experience together with us as rewarding and enjoyable as we possibly can.

 - You're totally a problem solver kind of person
 - Teamwork is the way you love to work i.e. collaborating with colleagues to get sh*t done
 - And you're a superb communicator (written and spoken English)


About Us


We're a team of entrepreneurs, innovators and doers who work hard, solve fast and do it all imaginatively because that’s how growth and success happen. Heaps of grit here.


Our venture, MeasureMatch, is on a mission to reinvent the way businesses access and benefit from enterprise technology & data professional services. 


Specifically, we're helping business leaders to rapidly advance their marketing, commerce, customer experience and related analytics capabilities via a 3-sided marketplace platform for the buying, selling and scaling of enterprise technology & data services.


MeasureMatch is where brands and agencies get important systems and data execution work done faster. Project work. Remote work. Implementation work. Configuration work. Integration work. Troubleshooting work. Valuable work. Fast.


We’re a lean team of good humans who value ideas (lots and lots of ideas), we build relationships, we try lots of new things, we strive to provide amazing customer service and selling isn't all about making money (although that's pretty important).

items.content:
Location: Remote, London post Covid-19 lockdown


Duration: 3 months


Start Date: ASAP


This internship is for those who are looking to get experience in a professional environment, especially in Sales and Marketing space.


Main Duties and Responsibilities:



  1. Research and Strategy development.

  2. Develop and manage B2B sales and marketing campaigns.

  3. Support management team in sales and marketing efforts.

  4. Keep up to date with industry related news and events by reading related magazines etc.

  5. Manage social media and search engine analytical tools for campaigns and monitoring.

  6. Report figures, developments etc. in a timely manner.


PERSON SPECIFICATION


This is an exciting opportunity in a start up with ambitious plans and ideal for a graduate who is looking for an internship in a still relatively young company, where there are exciting challenges to be had. As an evolving company you will be able to see your efforts help to shape and expand the company. You will bring creativity, can-do attitude and enthusiasm to work as part of a performance-driven team dedicated to the delivery of the highest quality.


Skills, Qualifications and Experience:



  • Relationship Management.

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills; the ability to communicate effectively, exemplary professional conduct.

  • Ability to meet targets and strict deadlines and work well under pressure. Attention to detail, highly organised and efficient approach to tasks.


Other Essential Attributes:



  • A can-do attitude to confront problems proactively and create successful solutions.

  • A good team player.

  • A passion for continuous improvement, creativity and result orientation.

  • Willingness to work flexibly to meet the requirements.

  • Ability to work independently without continuous supervision.


Other Responsibilities & Requirements:



  • Take all reasonable care of the health and safety of yourself, other people and resources.

  • Comply with the Health and Safety Policy and Protocols and Procedures Handbook.

  • The successful candidate may be required to work outside of core hours.


Development:


We are passionate about developing aspiring young talents. The candidate will have hands on experience with all areas of marketing activities. Candidate will have opportunity to work alongside management team thus providing unique opportunity to involve with business and strategy. Achieve a suitable reference for your first steps in your career.


This internship suites well to students who requires to go through a work experience in a professional environment. This job description provides an outline of the major focus areas of the internship and is not exhaustive and is subject to amendment from time to time.

items.title: Business Development Manager - Charity Partnerships
items.content:
We’re looking for a Business Development Manager to join our growing Charity Partnerships team at Farewill.


Charities have been an integral part of our success. We work with over 60 charities in the UK as their will writing provider, and help them raise funds from gifts in wills. To date our customers have pledged over £120m to charity.


We have ambitious plans for next year, and we’ll be investing in our team and our technology to deliver even more for our charity partners. This role is a unique opportunity to be part of that growth, help us change the way the world deals with death, and raise millions in gifts for charity.


In the next 12 months you will:



  • Generate new business opportunities with prospective clients

  • Take ownership of the full sales cycle from generating leads, demonstrating our product, negotiation and closing

  • Build a strong pipeline of relevant opportunities to deliver against and ensure goals are met

  • Build and maintain an in-depth understanding of our product by working closely with our customer support and product team

  • Attend events to network to generate interest in the Farewill proposition for charities

  • Deliver a world class service to our charity partner


Hopefully, you’ll have some or all of the following:



  • 2-3 years + experience in a sales role

  • A desire to genuinely help charities with their legacy fundraising

  • Proven track record of meeting targets

  • A consultative sales style, built on knowledge, trust and reliability

  • Proven ability to identify and develop new business

  • A passion for our mission to change the way the world deals with death (and raise millions for charities in doing so!)


If this sounds like what you’d love to be doing, we can’t wait to hear from you. If you’re not sure that you exactly fit the above criteria, get in touch anyway. Personality and attitude is just as important as experience.


What we offer in return:



  • £30,000-46,000 basic salary + commission (based on experience)

  • 28 days of annual leave plus the usual public holidays

  • Work from home on Wednesdays, flexible start and end to your day

  • Regular off-site days and team lunches

  • Santander cycles membership!

  • A chance to make a meaningful contribution to people's lives and deaths


And much more!


About Farewill:
At Farewill, we’re out to change the way the world deals with death. Helping people to take control, personally and financially, of what matters to them after they’re gone.


We launched our first product - our will-writing service - in December 2016, and since then we’ve grown to be the largest will-writer in the UK. We launched our second product, Probate, in early 2019, and recently our third, Cremation.


Our growth to date has been driven by an exceptional product (see our customer reviews) and key strategic partnerships. We’ve been featured in Forbes, The Times, The Guardian and on Radio 4 among others. We're also making waves in the charity world - with over £100 million raised for charities on our platform from gifts left in wills.


Our team:
We’re a creative, focused team who love what we do. We have backgrounds in design, technology, behavioural psychology, and management consultancy. We love to learn from each other and our customers, and grow together as a team.


Based in our lovely office in Haggerston, we’re backed by some of the best investors in Europe - from the founders of Transferwise and Zoopla, to Kindred Capital, SAATCHiNVEST, JamJar and DMGT.
This is an unusual, fascinating, and emotional area to work in – if you’re up for a big challenge we’d love to meet you.


If you’d like to understand our culture and product better, here’s a few articles for you to read: About Farewill, Life at Farewill, Are you worried about your will?


Please note - In light of the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak, all Farewill employees are working remotely and we will be conducting all interviews virtually for the foreseeable future. We will continue hiring as usual.

items.content:
Sales Development Representative, at Learnerbly


Given the current circumstances this role is 100% remote at the moment. 


25-28k per annum, 30k OTE


*** PLEASE APPLY THROUGH THIS LINK https://learnerbly.teamtailor.com/jobs/860864-sales-development-representative?promotion=153589-trackable-share-link-learnerbly-website


Learnerbly is a London based Workplace Learning Platform that enables people to be their best selves at work.  


Our mission is to work with organisations to create a progressive learning culture that empowers their people to own their development, guides them towards the best learning opportunities and supports them in applying their learnings.  


We're looking for a Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our team.


We will be hiring on a rolling basis.


 


Responsibilities



  • Outbound prospecting (bringing customers in)

  • Focus on lead generation and qualification 

  • Lead list management including list generation platforms, marketing and third party data providers.

  • CRM management (Via Hubspot), automation and task setup and management, including best practice process execution. 

  • Connect with new buyers and speak with them about their challenges.

  • Actively listening and educating customers leveraging insights to assist solving a real problem customers are having.

  • Support the BDM team on which leads they should focus their time with.

  • Building a confident, consultative thought provoking social selling profile. 

  • Sending emails at scale, making phone calls, booking meetings and social selling profile management.


 


Requirements


These are ideal but not required as we know some people are less likely to apply for the role unless they are 100% qualified. We promote a diverse, inclusive and empowering culture at Learnerbly.



  • A well prepared individual with strong research skills that is methodical and structured in identifying in market customers. Combined with a curious and proactive mindset.

  • The ability to make more calls and send more emails that are timely, relevant and in context for our customers.

  • A demonstrable track record of high performance in setting up quality meetings and appointments.

  • Understands the value and importance of revenue and time priorisation.

  • Data driven - Measurement KPIs focused, dedicated to pushing more leads into the flywheel.

  • A thorough knowledge of the digital ecosystem as it applies to Learnerbly’s business and its clients’ activities and needs

  • The ability to identify client challenges, and develop creative solutions in close collaboration with clients

  • The ability to effectively and persuasively communicate with C-suite leaders of scale-up businesses as well as FTSE 100 / 250 decision-makers.

  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and listening skills

  • A self-starter, entrepreneurial mindset and willingness to take responsibility for the full stack of business development development activities: you enjoy working as part of a small team, rapidly iterating on strategy, and roll up your sleeves to build something great

  • The ability to speak a second European language a plus – Swedish, Dutch, German and Spanish in particular.


What our clients and users want



  •  A consultative and thoughtful partner who can identify education-based solutions to business problems

  • Someone who understands how startups as well as large organisations work

  • Someone who doesn’t visibly “sell”, but instead guides clients through a complicated buying process


 


Benefits


We’re passionate about learning and development and will do everything we can to maximise your personal and career growth. Check out our Employee Guide for more details!


You’ll also receive:



  • Competitive salary and result-driven bonus

  • Flexible working environment and hours

  • Values-driven culture

  • £1,000 learning and well-being budget to spend each year

  • 25 days paid holiday

  • Free on-site barista coffee, herbal teas and fresh fruit

  • Quarterly team off-sites and outings

  • Healthcare cashback scheme available 


 


Our Values


We look for people who share our values and can add to our culture. 



  • Be your authentic self: For us, this means finding the intersection between what you love and what you’re good at, so you can be yourself at work.

  • Set the destination, own the journey: "Be the change you want to see in the world." Think big, speak up, take ownership. We believe in learning by experimenting and failing fast: use your creativity and resourcefulness to find solutions to problems you encounter.

  • Invite everyone to dance: “Diversity is being invited to the party, inclusion is being asked to dance.” We look for people who share our values and contribute to our culture. Diversity alone is not enough. We believe by being diverse and inclusive we make better decisions.

  • Practice heartfelt, radical candor: We know seeking radically candid feedback can be hugely powerful. We proactively seek and give feedback to reveal blindspots and accelerate growth.


*** PLEASE APPLY THROUGH THIS LINK https://learnerbly.teamtailor.com/jobs/860864-sales-development-representative?promotion=153589-trackable-share-link-learnerbly-website

Rent.Works is the premier digital magazine dedicated to everyone involved in the fast-moving private rental sector.

This is a great opportunity for someone new to this industry. Ambitition, determination and iniative more important than experience 


The role is home based and will require a number of different duties including basic administration. Salary according to experience 


Immediate start

items.content:
About us


Brompton Bike Hire was established to address the clear need for a cycle hire scheme that is accessible to all, easy and cheap to install and run, economical to use, not dependent on state subsidies, flexible and compact. The company is expanding rapidly across the UK with over 55 locations and is committed to providing an efficient, flexible, healthy and environmentally friendly solution to travel for the future, transforming cities by providing the means to commute or explore, with a bike that you can take anywhere, we can change the way people live in cities. Our high-quality products, combined with the resurgence in cycling, means that we are enjoying strong, sustained growth. To continue to thrive we need to recruit great people who can contribute to our ambitious aims.


Brompton Bike Hire have created a new role within the organisation to respond to the exceptional increase in Business Development enquiries from businesses. Reporting directly to the Managing Director, the purpose of the role is to take ownership of all Corporate Business development with special focus on Corporate Memberships and Corporate Pool Bike Schemes. This will include processing new sales leads as necessary, creating reports, creating standard proposals, arranging appointments with clients and attending said appointments as appropriate, acknowledging customers by responding to emails, texts, and phone calls. You will be responsible for the end to end sales process. As the employee matures in the role, there will be an opportunity to take on increasing areas of the sales channel. This is only limited by the capability and ambition of the candidate.


Brompton Bike Hire is a sister company to Brompton Bikes. The Brompton is acknowledged worldwide as the finest bike of its type and this excellence, means we are enjoying strong, sustained growth. Brompton Bikes is the largest manufacturer of bikes in the UK and Brompton Bike Hire provides the most extensive Bike Hire solution in the UK.


If you have huge enthusiasm, thrive on being given responsibility and want to change the way businesses approach travel then we can offer you a job you won’t find anywhere else.


A background in Business to Business sales and ideally Corporate memberships would be desirable, but far more important is a passion and tenacity that you bring to the role.


The role


Leading efforts to establish and retain business growth opportunities. Primarily obtaining new clients and fostering business relationships to increase revenue from sales.


Main duties and responsibilities



  • Fully owning the Corporate Membership and Company Pool bikes sales channels

  • Finding new clients and promoting sales to them

  • Identifying key accounts

  • Contacting potential clients to establish rapport and arrange meetings

  • Planning and overseeing new marketing initiatives.

  • Following up on client leads

  • Researching organizations and individuals to find new opportunities. Increasing the value of current customers while attracting new ones

  • Being knowledgeable about products and services offered by the business

  • Selling products and services in person and over the phone

  • Raising the company profile by attending expositions and seminars

  • Suggesting new projects such as product development to tap into new markets

  • Being aware of market trends and competitors

  • Complying with regulations and laws of business development

  • Maintaining a positive attitude that inspires co-workers and clients to grow the business

  • Reporting on the most productive sales professionals

  • Writing reports and analysing relevant business data

  • Presenting findings to the team

  • Promoting a culture of growth through sales across the business

  • Educating team members on best business practices and techniques for increasing effectiveness


Desirable Skills


Leadership, Education, Charisma, Sales, Communication, Finance, Marketing, Report Writing, Spreadsheets, Problem-Solving, Independence, Teamwork


Job Profile


Brompton utilises Personal Profile Analysis and Psychometric Assessment during the recruitment process. This allows to identify the ideal behavioural requirements for each job function in terms of Dominance, Influence, Steadiness and Compliance. The ideal behavioural profile for this role is set out below:

The Job Profile indicates that the person in this job should be friendly, assertive, independent, quick paced and have the ability to motivate others. Contact ability and communication are also likely to be key notes, as the job environment may require the active influencing and persuading of a variety of people in changing situations. The generation of many contacts and involvement in buying a product or concept by gaining willing acceptance may be important within the function. The incumbent should enjoy challenging situations and have the flexibility to work in an unstructured environment with freedom to act and the authority to make decisions.


Influence (High I)


Social activities and community responsibilities external to the organisation will sometimes be required of the successful candidate. Candidates who exude natural self-confidence will be actively sought after. The ability to make favourable impressions on others will be an important attribute.


Dominance (High D)



  • The ability to solve problems and implement appropriate remedial measures would benefit the incumbent.

  • An assertive, but not an aggressive, style could be a requirement of this post.

  • Reacting quickly to change will be viewed in a positive light.


Compliance (Low C)



  • Strong-willed and independent candidates will comply with a number of important components of this role.

  • Firm, even, at times, unconventional independence, will be a requirement of this position.

  • Someone, who is policy compliant, systematic and perfectionistic may not be compatible with the key requirements of this position.


Steadiness (Low S)



  • Candidates who are always looking for new and better ways of doing things will be welcomed in this role.

  • Mobility and alertness will be required of incumbents who intend to perform satisfactorily in this position.

  • People with a clearly goal-directed restlessness will qualify for short-listing in this position.


Benefits


Brompton offers you a very excellent working environment with enthusiastic colleagues who get along very well, communicate and cooperate with each other. The working climate is informal, but we work hard. Next to good terms of employment Brompton offers you the opportunity to work in a responsible and challenging job within a dynamic, international and ambitious environment. We are all proud to be part of Brompton Bicycle; we all share the same passion and dedication to the company and embrace differences in cultural backgrounds and skills.



  • Huge discount on your very own Brompton (family and friends get discount too)

  • Position to thrive. Whether you’re early in your career or an experienced professional, Brompton provides you with everything you need to excel in your job and for personal growth. You will be actively encouraged to increase your skillset and to attend relevant events

  • 20 days holiday plus Bank Holidays, increasing the longer you stay with us

  • Workplace Pension Scheme, Season Ticket Loan, Childcare Vouchers, Flexible Working, Cycle to Work Scheme to name just a few....

  • Birthday Breakfast, Family Fun Days, Christmas Parties, London to Brighton Bike Rides, Charity Raffles, volunteering with the local community all go towards creating a working environment that is fun and enriching


How to Apply: If you feel you fit within the Brompton team spirit and you can bring talent, innovation and enthusiasm to our workforce then please email your CV and covering letter.


Applicants must have the right to work in the United Kingdom.

items.title: Business Development Executive
items.content:
We’re looking for a Business Development Executive to join our growing Cremation team at Farewill.


We’re the fastest-growing company in the UK end-of-life sector, now starting to revolutionise the funeral industry. This role is in a tight-knit team building our direct cremation business. You’ll shape our service and how we work to ensure our customers are well looked after every step of the way. This is an amazing, meaningful opportunity for someone with experience of - and a passion for - helping people in difficult circumstances.


In the next 12 months you will:



  • Acquire customers by building awareness of our service amongst end-of-life professionals in your local area - we want every single [hospice nurse, counsellor, etc] to be an advocate.

  • Take ownership of the full sales cycle from generating leads, selling the benefits of our service, closing and implementing the deal.

  • Build a strong pipeline of relevant opportunities to deliver against and ensure goals are met

  • Build and maintain an in-depth understanding of our product by working closely with our customer support and product team

  • Attend events and network to generate interest in the Farewill proposition for key groups

  • Think creatively about local opportunities that may help increase our awareness (radio? Publications? Football team sponsorship?)


The role is remote - you’ll spend most of your time meeting with care professionals, pitching our services in person, and setting up deals. Expect to spend lots of time traveling around your local area!


You will be the first hire in a brand new channel for Farewill Cremation, and so it’ll be up to you to prove it works - an amazing opportunity for someone with an entrepreneurial spirit.


Hopefully, you’ll have some or all of the following:



  • 2-3 years’ experience within a similar role

  • A desire to genuinely help families find the funeral service that’s right for them

  • Proven track record of meeting targets

  • A consultative sales style, built on knowledge, trust, reliability and care

  • Proven ability to identify and develop new business

  • A passion for our mission to change the way the world deals with death (and raise millions for charities in doing so!)


If this sounds like what you’d love to be doing, we can’t wait to hear from you. If you’re not sure that you exactly fit the above criteria, get in touch anyway. Personality and attitude are just as important as experience!


What we offer in return:



  • Competitive salary and generous stock options

  • 28 days of annual leave plus the usual public holidays

  • Regular off-site days and team lunches

  • £1000 personal development budget a year

  • A chance to make a meaningful contribution to people's lives and deaths

  • And much more!


About Farewill:


At Farewill, we’re out to change the way the world deals with death. Helping people to take control, personally and financially, of what matters to them after they’re gone.


We launched our first product - our will-writing service - in December 2016, and since then we’ve grown to be the largest will-writer in the UK. We launched our second product, Probate, in early 2019, and recently our third, Cremation.


Our growth to date has been driven by an exceptional product (see our customer reviews) and key strategic partnerships. We’ve been featured in Forbes, The Times, The Guardian and on Radio 4 among others. We're also making waves in the charity world - with over £100 million raised for charities on our platform from gifts left in wills.


Our team:


We’re a creative, focused team who love what we do. We have backgrounds in design, technology, behavioural psychology, and management consultancy. We love to learn from each other and our customers, and grow together as a team.


Based in our lovely office in Haggerston, we’re backed by some of the best investors in Europe - from the founders of Transferwise and Zoopla, to Kindred Capital, SAATCHiNVEST, JamJar and DMGT.


This is an unusual, fascinating, and emotional area to work in – if you’re up for a big challenge we’d love to meet you.


If you’d like to understand our culture and product better, here’s a few articles for you to read: About Farewill, Life at Farewill, Are you worried about your will?

items.content:
Title:


Business Development Representative


Salary:


£25,000 + Share Options + Commission


Benefits:


25 days holiday + bank holidays, lunch & learns, flexible working (including remote), personal development funding and access to training.


Reports to:


Head of Sales


Company background:


At Attractions.io we're shaking up the way attractions use technology — powering incredible guest experiences for some of the best-known brands in the industry, including Alton Towers, Paultons Park and LEGOLAND. We're already serving millions of guests at world-class attractions every year and have ambitious plans for growth.


Job overview:


Your mission will be to generate and qualify leads for our sales team by consulting with prospects to identify their challenges and educate them on the benefits of our product.


As we are selling a complex software solution, you will gain a deep understanding of our offering and engage with prospects in a consultative manner to help them solve their challenges and meet personal objectives.


As well as offering a competitive base salary, employee share options and performance-based commission, you will be part of a growing team and the right candidates will have opportunities to progress into more senior roles.


Responsibilities:



  • Become an expert in the Attractions.io product

  • Promptly respond to inbound leads

  • Research and reach out to prospects via email and telephone

  • Build a better picture of prospects by performing desk research and updating our CRM

  • Conduct discovery calls to qualify prospects

  • Set appointments for product demonstrations

  • Be a thought leader and educate leads by sharing relevant content

  • Follow the sales process to nurture and convert leads into qualified opportunities

  • Make suggestions on how we can improve the sales process for even better results

  • Compose proposals and see contracts through to signature


Traits & skills:



  • The ability to express ideas and concepts in a compelling way and position yourself as a trusted advisor

  • A motivated self-starter who can work on their own initiative and consistently demonstrates an enthusiastic, ‘never give up’ attitude

  • A confident communicator with the ability to build rapport across all levels of an organisation

  • Natural curiosity with a desire to learn and improve through training and coaching

  • The ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment

  • Strong written communication with high attention to detail

  • Keen to bring your own ideas on how we can continually improve

  • Strong admin skills to keep our CRM system accurate and up-to-date


Desired experience:



  • Previously held a customer-facing role in sales or customer support

  • Familiar with using and maintaining a CRM system

  • Having worked for a SaaS software company would be desirable but not essential


Culture & values: 


Be inquisitive: Our team is always working on new ways of bringing innovative technology to our clients. We’re looking for someone who can challenge the status-quo and not be afraid to put forward a better way of doing things.


Be the expert: Our clients appreciate the intelligent, thought-provoking conversations we have with them about their needs. We’re looking for someone who’s keen to keen to learn and build a voice in the industry as a trusted advisor.


Be passionate: Our team is unashamedly obsessed with attractions, we really care about helping our clients to give their visitors a fantastic experience and get results! We’re looking for someone with a positive mindset who acts with integrity, honesty and enthusiasm and like us, really cares about helping our clients, and the industry, to succeed. 


Be results-focused: It’s really important to us that our work has a positive impact and not only meets our customers’ expectations but also exceeds them. Innovative thinking and cutting edge technology ensures that what we deliver for our clients is effective, and something we’re proud of. We’re looking for someone that always goes the extra mile and prioritises craftsmanship and attention-to-detail in everything they do, to ensure every interaction provides real value and measurable results.

items.title: Business Development Executive
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Job Title: Business Development Executive


Hours: Full Time


Joining: As soon as possible


Location: 118A London Wall, Moorgate, London, EC2Y 5JA (currently working remotely). Some travel may be required.


Benefits: £23-25k basic with commission structure, equity in Reducer, rapid career progression


Website: https://reducer.co.uk


About Reducer


Reducer is a rapidly growing London based startup helping accountants to find savings for their clients.


Businesses have purchasing requirements that are too complex for traditional price comparison approaches to work. By connecting into a business’ accounts Reducer is able to identify customised deals in just a couple of clicks.  We then talk them through the savings and help them make any they’d like to take.


We are one of the few companies that are thriving in this current economic climate as we’re helping other businesses cut their costs and survive through this tough time.


Our customers love our service and we are growing fast.


We’ve just raised our second round of funding and we are heading into a phase of rapid expansion.


The team and environment


Our success is entirely owned by our team, who are all self-starters that enjoy working together to hit our ambitious targets. The office is relaxed and informal, we often play music, eat lunch as a team and share a game of darts (not all at the same time).


Right now, we are all working remotely and have a daily meeting on Google Hangouts as well as an end of the week catch up & drinks.


 


Your role


Reporting to the Head of Sales, you will be responsible for converting deals offered to our business customers. This will include energy, telecoms and card payments contracts.


The day-to-day of the role will involve calling warm leads, prospecting & research, CRM management, conducting ‘savings consultations’ and occasionally face-to-face meetings. You will be responsible for hitting your own target as well as contributing towards the company target.


About you


You will meet all of our key requirements including:



  • Excellent phone manner 

  • Excellent prospecting & research skills

  • 1-2 years experience in sales


Most of your interactions with clients will be over the phone, so having a relaxed and friendly phone manner which will put customers at ease is essential. 


You might have some of our value-add requirements:



  • Good numeracy skills

  • Ability to learn/pick things up quickly

  • Experience selling utilities


There will be times you may be required to support the accountant sales team by booking appointments for them. This will involve making cold calls and prospecting accountants.


What to expect



  • Equity in the company

  • Flexible working arrangements

  • An inclusive approach where you are regularly consulted on our direction

  • A hard-working environment but without the long hours

  • Regular team events and socials

  • Enrolment in our pension scheme

items.content:
Keep You Posted Digital launched at the beginning of 2019, and has had great success ever since.Keep You Posted Digital offers an extremely personal and tailored approach to integrated digital marketing to a number of game changing clients. We consult. We create. We inspire. We build brands, but most importantly, we build trust. All doing so without a presence. Our work, is in turn the client's work. We offer the following services: Social Paid Advertising | Digital Strategy | Social Media Management | Influencer Marketing This job role would be for a Business Development Director.


After spending much of my career between sales and marketing, I believe that if you want to succeed, you should be able to reap the benefits. For this reason, this role is commission only. Your OTE will be 5 figures a month if you’re willing to put in the work.


Social Media Marketing is the most in demand service on the planet, therefore closing clients has become less of a sales challenge but more of a time challenge, hence hiring... This role is completely remote, perfect for the COVID-19 challenge our economy is facing right now.


Requirements:


2-3 years sales background 


Confident telephone manner


Impeccable standard of appearance


A understanding of the current marketing landscape in the UK.


The 'would be nice':


Understanding of social media marketing


Demonstrated experience in a similar role


A network of successful business prospects.


Benefits:



  • Work from home opportunities

  • Flexible working hours

  • Bonus scheme

items.title: Business Development Coordinator
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Are you a self-starter with a positive attitude, natural curiosity, passion for continuous learning and improvement, a personable demeanour, bags of initiative, and strong analytical skills? 


Yes? Then keep reading.


Who are VidOps?


VidOps are visual storytellers and expert video-creators. We manage all aspects of the production lifecycle from pre-production through to production and shooting footage, post-production edits and final delivery of media content, along with our community of creative talent. 


We designed the business this way so our clients can focus on their daily operations without worrying about their internal media production projects – whilst being supported with planning, updated on project progress and have their edited content delivered online.


We are a London-based startup currently working towards our series A investment round – focusing on improving our current service offering and also developing a web application which will support all areas of the business. We are a small multi-functional team, wearing multiple hats, working hard and enjoying ourselves along the way. 


What you would be doing


As we expand our client base, we’re looking for the right person to join our Commercial team, specifically,as part of a business development function. We want you to get the VidOps message out there. Identify opportunities, develop initiatives for growth and secure new business by generating leads and sales with the ultimate goal of bringing on new clients to our platform.


Key responsibilities:



  1. Managing a portfolio of prospective clients who are at varying stages of the pipeline with VidOps’ products and services.

  2. Seamlessly hand over management of new clients to the Operations team.

  3. Creating and implementing sales strategies and identifying new markets to enter.

  4. Conducting market research to identify new business development opportunities.

  5. Building strong working relationships, organising and attending scoping meetings to understand potential client briefs and building out relevant solutions and proposals.

  6. Identifying upsell opportunities for additional partnership activities to achieve increased revenues.

  7. Delivering new client presentations, articulating the VidOps proposition and most relevant value-add solutions.

  8. Leading kick-off meetings/calls with client contacts and delivery teams to ensure campaigns are clearly planned and handed over to our Production team.

  9. Administrative responsibilities for client accounts on our internal CRM system (Hubspot)

  10. Providing demos of our products and services to prospective clients 


Who you are



  1. You ideally have a background in film, creative production or digital marketing or are interested in video 

  2. You have a strong sense of urgency and exceptional organisational skills

  3. You are passionate and enthusiastic self-starter and up for a challenge

  4. You are solutions oriented, seeing a problem and coming up with creative solutions to problems

  5. You can quickly immerse yourself in startup culture--can quickly adapt to change at a high speed pace, is data-driven, and can be fully ramped to achieve new business targets

  6. You enjoy and embrace technology, VidOps is a tech/media startup after all 

  7. You are an analytical and strategic thinker, with a logical approach to problem-solving

  8. You are confident, proactive, full of perseverance and ambition with absolutely no ego

  9. You have exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal communicator, as building authentic relationships with customers is vital to the role


Why join the team?


At VidOps, you’ll be working in a fast-paced, highly-collaborative environment as a core part of a small, focused, multidisciplinary Commercial team. You’ll be working directly with the CEO.


It’s an exciting opportunity for the right person to learn a lot and progress quickly, with lots of freedom and challenges that come with an entrepreneurial, early stage startup at the beginnings of growth. If you want an opportunity to be a core part in moulding the future of the department and company, then this is the role for you!


There’s lots of social activities, company nights out and a free fully stocked fridge with plenty of beer, milk (cow and oat!), juice and coffee machine, not to mention our communal office has a ping-pong table and pool table, onsite cafe, showers and is just off Notting Hill’s famous Portobello Road.


 


Role Requirements


Essential:



  1. 1+ years experience in either a relationship management or sales role

  2. Keen to further progress a sales career in a fast-paced, high-growth commercial environment

  3. Confident communicator, both in person and online

  4. Demonstrable experience of building strong professional relationships

  5. Proactive with the ability to multitask and prioritise

  6. Creative and solutions focused

  7. Willingness to work flexibly  and wear multiple hats in a fast-growing business environment


Desired:



  1. Experience of using Hubspot CRM

  2. Knowledge of video production


Compensation



  1. Base salary £25,000.00

  2. Bonus incentive


    1. Departmental Bonus

    2. Company performance Bonus


  3. Equity through EMI share option scheme 0.33%


Benefits



  1. High-growth, entrepreneurial environment

  2. Exposure to all areas of the business, with opportunity to undertake business-wide projects

  3. Career progression with associated pay increases and opportunities to be on the employee share scheme

  4. 28 days holiday including bank holidays

  5. Working remotely/flexible working

  6. Open plan London office, with snacks and a beer fridge

  7. Team building activities every 2 weeks

items.content:
At Thirsty Thoughts we blend technology and booze to generate engagement for clients planning knockout events all over the world. Ever wanted a mind-controlled beer-pouring robot? We’ve built one. Ever fancied pouring champagne by simply gesturing towards a bottle? We made it happen. Now we are looking for someone to help drive our great ideas forward and build on the sales success we have enjoyed to date, with clients including Adidas, Google and Twitter activating experiences across Europe and, most recently, with the Wall Street Journal in the US. 


 


After a successful first year, we’re looking to rapidly grow the business in 2020 and dominate the high-end event entertainment market. For that to happen, we are in need of a bright, entrepreneurial and resourceful Business Development Officer to take charge of our Sales and Marketing process. This is an excellent opportunity for an ambitious sales specialist who is looking for large amounts of responsibility and the ability to grow with a business. You’ll join a tight-knit team with a shared passion of technology, drinks and delivering unique experiences.


 


Responsibilities:



  • Build business by identifying and selling to prospective clients; as well as maintaining relationships with existing clients to ensure repeat purchase.

  • Build a roster of event agency partners who will resell our products to their clients. Keep these partners informed of new developments and making sure they are selling our products correctly. 

  • Identify business opportunities by identifying prospects and evaluating their position in the industry; researching and analyzing sales options.

  • Work closely with the Managing Director to devise and implement an effective inbound marketing strategy.

  • Constantly test and adapt your strategy to ensure you’re getting results.

  • Identify potential product improvements or new products by remaining current on industry trends, market activities, and competitors.

  • Prepare sales reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing performance.

  • Eventually build out your own sales and marketing team and lead them to glory.


 


 


The successful candidate needs to have/be:



  • Excellent commercial awareness

  • A “people person” - it’s essential that you can forge close working relationships with our clients and agency partners

  • High energy

  • Happy to muck in and help the team when necessary

  • Negotiation skills

  • Good written communication skills

  • Creativity

  • Independence and self-motivation in abundance


 


Education, Experience, and Licensing Requirements:



  • Bachelor's Degree

  • At least one year of industry sales experience

  • Proven knowledge and execution of successful development strategies


 


Remuneration and Benefits


 



  • £20,000 - £25,000 per annum base salary, dependant on experience

  • 10% commission, uncapped, on the gross value of all deals

  • £40,000 - £50,000 OTE

  • Options scheme after 6 months

  • Work from home options

  • International travel, we took our robots to 10 different countries last year and always have time for fun while we’re abroad.

  • Free drinks in the office

items.content:
We’re looking for someone who wants to bring a game-changing solution to an industry ripe for reinvention -- and help us connect with those who can use our platform to change the way we build.


This is a high-energy, new sales development role with a focus on finding new potential customers across the UK and European region. You will contribute to Disperse hyper-growth by helping to acquire new clients.


We are looking for driven professionals who are willing to strongly contribute and ready to work in a fast build & learn environment.


You will gain experience interacting with prospective clients of all levels and in an industry ready for transformation.


If you’re eager to learn and aren’t afraid to dive straight into new challenges, then this role is a great opportunity to develop a multidisciplinary skill-set alongside a world-class team.


In this role, you will:



  • Research prospective customers, create outreach strategies, and identify sales opportunities

  • Create and prioritize strategic target account lists

  • Connect and conduct first-class exploratory conversations with potential customers

  • Conduct needs qualification calls with specific prospects

  • Work closely and collaboratively with Account Executives to develop and implement appropriate prospecting strategies and help fill their sales pipeline

  • Achieve monthly quotas of qualified new business opportunities

  • Have an opportunity to grow the BDR role/function/team





Requirements



You should apply if:



  • Proven work experience as a Business Development Representative or in a B2B sales capacity (min. 1 year)

  • Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including calling)

  • Track record of achieving sales/BDR quotas

  • Experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce)

  • Understanding of sales performance metrics

  • You possess excellent verbal and written communication skills



  • You’re organised and methodical with a keen attention to detail

  • You can think yourself deep into the mind of others to understand and address their key interests and challenges

  • You’re a highly motivated ‘self-starter’ with professional persistence.

  • You have an excellent track record of academic achievement and being a team player: down to earth and willing to do what it takes for the team to succeed.

  • You’re eligible to work in the UK as no visa sponsorship is available for this position.


In addition, it is useful but not essential, if you have:



  • Previous experience in a startup environment.

  • Experience/knowledge of the construction industry

  • French or German language is a plus.





Benefits




  • Experience firsthand what it takes to scale up an AI startup

  • Competitive compensation

  • Friendly, open and transparent culture

  • Health insurance (Vitality + Gym membership discounts)

  • Pension scheme

  • Flexible working hours / ability to work from home

  • Choose your work equipment / devices: your local office will provide you with options to choose from to help you set up the systems and work environment that will keep you happy and productive

  • Central London location (Tottenham Court Road)

  • Regular socials, and team retreats to amazing destinations (Tbilisi, Kiev... Where next?)
